data.title: Cool vibe restaurant in Lismore Hotel
data.text: Really cool ambience full-service restaurant in the lobby of the Lismore with good lighting and open kitchen, large windows, feels more like you are in downtown Chicago than Eau Claire. I have dined here several times as a business traveler staying at the hotel, not just out of convenience, but also because I think it is one of the best restaurants in Eau Claire. It has an urban big city vibe but with local Wisconsin ingredients and cuisine theme. Service is generally good and waiters are fairly attentive. Prices are moderate-range, probably little expensive for Eau Claire but on par with any big city sit-down restaurant of similar style. The food is great, love the salads and the cheese plate and the wine list is great too. My only complaint is the menu is small and in several business trips I feel like I have exhausted the menu, especially being vegetarian, options are limited here. There seem to be a lot of pork products on the menu, which would be quite limiting for anyone eating kosher as well. Wish they would have a pasta or another veggie dish and wish they were a little more healthy-oriented and used more variety of veggies, grains, etc. The one veggie dish they have includes smoked food, which I avoid due to being unhealthy. The pizza is good veggie option though and the desserts are absolutely delicious, the lemon sorbet with fragrant edible petals was to die for, can't wait to have it again when I go back there, one of my favorite desserts ever! Hoping to have more great options with the November menu.

data.title: A perfect night out
data.text: I'm amazed at the less than positive reviews of this place as it's probably the nicest dining establishment in E.C. Cool, modern interior that's warm and inviting. Attentive service that was friendly and helpful. The real star here is the food. Creative dishes, interesting combinations, and great taste! Interesting little touches like flavored salt to put on the butter for the rolls. My one wish is that they had tap beer. I mean, come on, this is Wisconsin!

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you very much for your kind review. We're truly working very hard at making our place unique and special and that our food is delicious! We do offer tap beer in ECDC and in The Informalist. Thanks again for your input! Our greatest reward is when our guests love what we're doing!
Best Regards, Terry V.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not what I had hoped for
data.text:
Eau Claire has a paucity of high quality local non chain restaurants and i was hoping that this one would help that situation out. The downtown location is great, the sharp lines, large windows and modern atmosphere are wonderful, but the food was a BIG disappointment. And the food is what makes or breaks a restaurant.

We began our brunch with Bloody Mary's that were watered down. It was not that the alcohol was too little, but rather that the mixer that was used was a very pale red color and pretty much tasteless. We even asked for some additional mixer and it barely helped. This is not a hard thing to make properly!! 

For our meals one of us had eggs benedict (very bland hollaindaise sauce) and the other had their signature burger. The burger tasted OK, but was way overdone. I asked for it medium rare and it was at least medium well which totally ruins the burger. While I know I could have sent it back, we were eating with a group of 4 and there is nothing worse than 3 people eating while the other one has to wait for their food. The key to getting properly cooked food is not to send it back if it is done wrong, but rather for it to be done right the first time. A competent chef can easily make a burger as ordered.

A very disappointing meal!!

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your input. We're glad you liked the space and our apologies for all not to be to your liking. We working hard at our menu to refine it and make it special! We hope you try us again soon as we believe we have made great improvement in our menus!
Kind Regards, Terry V.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Multiple dinners
data.text: Menu is very nice. Seems that it changes frequent which would be great for travelers. Located in a very cool hotel. The pizza has been the best part, kimchi pizza has been the best. Black garlic pasta was okay lacking a lot of flavor very bland and noodles were over cooked. Beet and quinoa burger sounded intriguing but the smoked peanut butter seemed to be smoked with liquid smoke and the burger did not hold up well. Grilled cauliflower was great, was well put together and had great flavor. Chicken pot pie was also very good the celery root purée makes a great base and very unexpected texture with the filling. So far they have also had the best bourbon, whiskey and scotch selection in the city. In my book that alone is well worth dinner.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review and your input! We're pleased you enjoyed your experience with us. We appreciate our guest's input on our offerings as this is how we refine our menu and selections. We look forward to seeing you again soon! Glad you liked our bourbon, whiskey and scotch selections!
Kind Regards, Terry V.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Multiple Breakfast Adventures and One Dinner
data.text: My partner and I appreciate a good breakfast and in this area there isn't a lot to come by that is unique and changes.  Informalist has a decently priced breakfast with unique options.  Dinner also has unique options but is quite expensive.  I know our mentality in this country is a lot of food for as low of a dollar amount as we can get it but I personally am not afraid to spend money on good food.  I'm also not going to spend a lot of money on something my father harvests yearly or spending a lot of money on multiple side orders in order to make an actual meal.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you and we're pleased you enjoy The Informalist! We have launched our new day and evening winter menus. We look forward to seeing you soon and trying these as we believe we have been responsive to our guests concerns.
Kind Regards, Terry V.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing
data.text: Wake up! Wake up! This is soooo good on so many levels!   Eau Claire...you are soooo lucky to have this venue. It's amazing. The hostess met us with a smile...Sam our waitress was superb and Amy the chef came out from the kitchen and served us a sweet potato smore (it was her own recipe)...the flavor and freshness of the food is top notch...and Bon Iver plays throughout the restaurant...I could have stayed all day...

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you very much for your kind review! We're very pleased you enjoyed your experience with The Informalist! We're truly shooting for "amazing"!
Best Regards, Terry V.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Better Things to Come
data.text: It has it all, location, space, and décor. We decided to try it out because they offered gluten free options for my wife. The food was decent, but nothing to write to Trip Advisor about. The price range was reasonable and our waitress was nice. We were just underwhelmed with the food. I think it's a newer restaurant and perhaps it's just getting it's feet wet. In time, hopefully, it will start to fill the seats.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for your input.

New menu launch November 3rd, Thursday! Please come and try. Better things are here! We'd love your input. Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you soon.
Best Regards, Terry V.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Average Experience
data.text: Very cool place for Eau Claire.  I have eaten breakfast, lunch and dinner and find the food and service good but not great.  Prices are on the higher end for Eau Claire.  Seating is a bit cramped in booth sections.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review. We're truly shooting for great! We're launching our new dinner menu Nov 2nd and we believe there are really great items on our new menu. We hope to see you soon and demonstrate our progress.

Cheers and Best Regards,
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Came here with my parents. Was severely disappointed. Good was cold and took forever. Flavors were good. But execution was poor. Big city feel and small town execution. Wishing them the best they have lots of kinks to workout.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
My sincere apologies for the cold food and your disappointing experience at our restaurant. I certainly hope that when you brought this to one of our hospitality team member's attention, we rectified the situation. I'm pleased you felt the favor was good and you liked how the look of the restaurant.

As we move forward into our second six months of operations, we are working towards big city execution. We have installed a beautiful new, high efficiency plate warmer which will solve our cold plate problem.

I do hope that when you're back in town, you give us another opportunity to provide you with something absolutely delicious!

Thank you for your input.
Kind Regards, 
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: We had an 11 AM Sunday reservation.  They immediately sat us but as we were being seated the hostess said the kitchen is really backed up so we aren’t taking any orders for 45 minutes.  Our server eventually came by and we asked about ordering coffee from the drink menu.  He said “sure but I’ll have to go next door to the hotel to get it.”  After waiting 45 minutes, he came and said “Ok they will let me take your food order now.”  My wife and I ordered Eggs Benedict she requested that the eggs not be runny.  The food finally came.  My eggs were literally hard boiled and hers were barely cooked.  We didn’t really want to complain because we didn’t have time for the slow kitchen to redo our meals, however, we did complain and the waiter just shrugged his shoulders and walked away.  When he brought the check, he said we took $12 off.  As bad as the food and service was they should have written the whole check off.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your input and my sincere apologies. I've done some research on your experience with us on Sunday and frankly, you're absolutely correct. I would like to extend to you an invitation to contact me directly. I truly want to make things right between us. 

I will be using this as training with our staff. Again, my apologies! I hope to talk with you soon.
Best Regards,
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dinner at the Informalist
data.text: We had a very nice dinner on a Friday night. There is no tap beer but the bottle selection was to my liking. The salad was good. I had the chicken and it was good, but no vegetables served. A little dry and could have used some sauce. The pizzas were good and we enjoyed them. We loved the atmosphere and it was quite busy. My advice for the Informalist as seen in other reviews is to concentrate on making good food not unusual food. The atmosphere is great. Keep it more in line with the restaurant goers in Eau Claire. Almost everyone says the food is too fancy and too expensive. I would chose Mona Lisa or Houligans for a nice dinner out over the Informalist at this point.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your input. Our restaurant is evolving and as we move into our 2nd half of our first year of being open, we continue to refine our selections. We're launching our new winter menu Nov. 2nd and I believe you will find more approachable items.

Best Reards and Thanks, 
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Grilled Caesar salad was terrible
data.text: I was at the Lismore hotel for job training so decided to eat here for lunch, was here with 2 friends also in job training, my friends had the Lismore burger and elk steak sandwich both came with fries, I had the grilled Caesar salad which I also added a picture to this trip advisor app, I have never had such a terrible Caesar salad in my lifetime and I love Caesar salad, it was nor grilled and it came in 2 loaves which was really wierd and it had Caesar dressing on top of the loaves, the salad came with 3 small slices of bread, with no butter or dressing on the bread, very disappointed in my meal, the service was slow and a friend of mine ordered a diet coke which the waiter brought when my friend was 2/3 done with his burger, the prices were very high and I will never go back here for any meal, I wish I could of given this review zero stars. Disappointing

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
My sincere apologies for your experience with us. I hope you reconsider and return and give us an opportunity to make things right.

Again, my apologies.
Best Regards, 
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hope it improves...
data.text: Met a friend in Eau Claire and we went to the bar. Interesting look. Tying to be a metro, minimalist establishment. But they don't serve food. Hard to avoid the sun in our eyes the ways it's set up. So we decided to try the restaurant. Nice server, not very private seating. Had the short ribs with homemade pasta which was fairly bland and not very noteworthy. No accompanying vegetable or greens. Their rolls were okay if you like a very hardy grain roll. Hard butter. My friend's chicken was nothing special.  Disappointment.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you very much for your input. We have made changes to our house made bread and butter program and we are launching our new dinner menu Nov 2nd. I believe the new menu will be very approachable and delicious! 

I hope to see you again soon and we can demonstrate our improvement!
Best Regards, 
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We enjoyed eating here for dinner and breakfast while staying at the hotel. The choices are amazing and all were delicious. They were very concerned that you enjoy your meal. Service was top notch.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you very much for your kind words! We've very pleased that you enjoyed your experience with us!

Best Regards, 
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great service
data.text:
First time visit at this new restaurant . All of our food came quickly and our waitress , Holly, gave us free dessert. She was helpful in providing recommendations on food and drinks. Food was good, slightly overpriced ($12-$25) per entree depending on what you order ($7-12) for a cocktail or wine. 
We came later on a Saturday night so it was quiet. Atmosphere is very nice. Little booths are not designed for anyone over 200lbs or 5'6". My boyfriend who is over 6' had no leg room. Adequate bar space. This is a great spot for a special occasion, business meeting, or a sophisticated cocktail date. Big windows that provide free entertainment of downtown Eau Claire. Next time we will come for drinks only and sit at the bar.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for your kind review. We're pleased that you enjoyed your visit with us! We look forward to seeing you soon.
Best regards, Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Food very fancy.
data.text: Food was TOO fancy! They've spent too much effort trying to do really fancy food.  For no reason.  Can't imagine this really appealing to the vast majority of Eau Claire.

data.title: Nice Classy eats
data.text: We decided to give The Informalist a try for a special birthday dinner with a friend. The meal was delicious and the atmosphere was wonderful.  The kitchen is open so you can see what is going on.  The whole space is open and airy and you can see what is happening on the street.  The seating areas are neat with clean lines. We started our meal with the smoked Trout Cakes which were delicious!  Loved the sauces. Our meals were wonderful and served pretty quickly.  I had the Trout entree and my friend had the Margherita pizza. We were there on a Thursday evening around 5:30 and the place filled up by the time we left with all the people going to the Sounds Like Summer concert in Phoenix Park. The park is a short walk away as is the parking ramps for parking.  The restaurant is located in the Lismore Hotel which has it's own parking ramp. Cost is pretty reasonable for parking.  There is also street parking but on a summer Thursday night in downtown Eau Claire, it's a little harder to find a spot. We truly enjoyed our experience and will come again.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you very much for your kind words. We look forward to seeing you soon!

Best Regards, Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Train your servers
data.text: Went there for lunch and ordered a bottle of wine. Server struggled to open since he didn't remove the foil . Instead he pulled the cork through leaving a ragged foil edge which made pouring difficult.  The food was erratically served as the server explained the kitchen had messed up the pizza so he served my wife's salad with overcooked dry chicken and brought my entree after she was halfway through her meal. The beet and goat cheese pizza was tasty the chicken salad pretty disappointing.

data.title: Fabulous out of the ordinary choices!
data.text: We love this place.  My husband travels and stays at Hiltons all the time, and has bestowed the "Best Hilton Restaurant" award to The Informalist.  Now, let me warn you -- if you want stock Wisconsin supper club food, go somewhere else.  If you want an omelet cooked perfectly and stuffed full of spinach and zucchini and other veggies; or Cuban pork picadillo topped with perfectly cooked eggs, or spinach and shallots with poached eggs and a vegan holladaise sauce that is fabulous -- this is your place.  We had lunch there -- my husband loved his quinoa burger with a peanut butter sauce, I had the whitefish burger that was great.  The service is friendly but can be a little slow -- so don't go there in a rush.  But we love this place.  But don't expect common fare.  The chef is creative and your palate will thank you.  But you may need to step out of your comfort zone.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello and Thank You mammacitarita!
We're very pleased you enjoyed The Informalist! My apologies for the "little slow" service. We're working to make our food the best and the service/hospitality impeccable!

Thanks again for your kind words and we look forward to seeing you and your husband again soon!

Best Regards, 
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great atmosphere, bland food
data.text: Went with friends. We all got something different and shared. Service was great. The trout cakes and beet salad were good, but all our other choices SEVERELY lacked seasoning/flavor. The house salad needed A LOT of salt and pepper - the honey herb vinaigrette had zero flavor. We all had to put salt on our wood fired pizzas - I've never had to salt pizza in my life! And the Quinoa Beet Burger also had zero seasoning/flavor and didn't have nearly enough peanut butter on it. One of our friends had been there once before and had a similar experience, but it was opening week and they provided feedback to the Manager (who came around to the tables and asked for honest feedback from everyone), so she was hopeful things had changed. Unfortunately, they haven't. We left disappointed. We will not be back.

owner_response.author: Terry V, General Manager at The Informalist, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello TeamNacho,

Our sincere apologies and we're disappointed you did not like several of your food selections. The Quinoa Burger is one of our guests favorite with the smoked peanut butter (we're always happy to provide additional smoked peanut butter upon guest request) and the sriracha chili sauce. It is meant to be anything but bland! Also, our wood fired pizzas are very popular and always meant to be very flavorful!

We would love to have an opportunity to turn your experience around with our restaurant. I would be delighted to host you at our place again. Please send a message if you would like and we can arrange. Best Regards, Terry V.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
